channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump disparages Michelle Obama at event meant to honor women's rights
Michelle Obama makes a moral case against Donald Trump at the Democratic National Convention
CNN's Dana Bash: Michelle Obama knew this would bother Trump
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper and Dana Bash discuss Michelle Obama's speech at the DNC. Watch her full speech here.

item.title: The biggest hurdle for Joe Biden
Life-long Republicans make the case for Biden at DNC
item.description: A group of life-long Republicans make the case for members of their party breaking with Donald Trump and backing Joe Biden.

item.title: Amsterdam has been collapsing for years. Now it's paying the price
item.description: Cracks and sinkholes are appearing alongside the waterways of Amsterdam.

item.title: USPS chief backs off changes amid uproar and lawsuits
item.description: At least 20 Democratic attorneys general across the country are launching a multi-pronged legal effort to push back on the Trump administration's recent changes that disrupted mail delivery across the country and triggered accusations that Trump and his appointees are trying to undermine mail-in voting.

item.title: If New Zealand's Covid-19 outbreak is 'terrible' like Trump says, then how bad is the rest of the world?
item.description: Speaking in Minnesota on Monday, United States President Donald Trump was apparently feeling vindicated.

item.title: 'Robust' immune response may offer hope of curbing the pandemic, experts say
item.description: Faster tests combined with a "robust" immune response against Covid-19 could soon mean a slower spread, researchers said.

item.title: Wuhan hosts massive water park party as coronavirus concerns recede
item.description: It was ground zero in the coronavirus pandemic and underwent the world's first -- and arguably strictest -- lockdown.

item.title: Number of Covid-19 cases in Paris jumps six-fold since beginning of month
Bipartisan Senate report finds Manafort sought to share info with Russian officer
item.description: The Senate Intelligence Committee released Tuesday the most comprehensive and meticulous examination to date explaining how Russia interfered in the 2016 presidential election and the Trump campaign welcomed the foreign adversary's help, revealing new information about contacts between Russian officials and associates of President Donald Trump during and after the campaign.

item.title: Mali soldiers reportedly arrest president and PM
item.description: Troops in Mali have arrested the country's President Ibrahim Boubacar Keita and Prime Minister Boubou Cisse in a suspected coup, according to the chairman of the African Union.

item.title: Parents in Italy no longer have to financially support their adult kids, court rules
item.description: Italian young adults do not have the automatic right to financial support from their parents, even if they aren't financially independent, Italy's Supreme Court has ruled.

item.title: Microsoft is slowly killing off its most reviled product
item.description: Internet Explorer is so reviled, even Microsoft is turning its back on it.

item.title: Wolf Blitzer presses Kushner: 1,000 deaths a day isn't success, right?
item.description: CNN's Wolf Blitzer talks to President Trump's senior adviser and son-in-law Jared Kushner.

item.title: They landed scholarships abroad. Now they are stranded and penniless
item.description: When Nigerian student Mercy Eyo landed a foreign postgraduate scholarship in July 2019, she had just lost her father. A year earlier, her mother had passed away.

item.title: The week that changed everything in Belarus
item.description: Gathered just outside the barbed wire fence, a group of protesters young and old raised their voices in song. Accompanied by a guitar, they sang, "Leave, leave peacefully, this is the will of Belarusians," to the guards at Detention Center No. 1.

item.title: New sanctions are a 'lethal blow' to Huawei, analysts warn
item.description: The United States has cut off Huawei's access to vital, advanced computer chips, striking a deadly blow to the Chinese tech champion.

item.title: Couple who pointed guns at protesters to speak at Republican convention
item.description: Patricia and Mark McCloskey, the St. Louis homeowners who pointed guns at protesters earlier this summer, are scheduled to speak at the Republican National Convention next week, an aide familiar told CNN on Monday.

item.title: The UK city that's been a draw for Confederate sympathizers
Rape and murder of 13-year-old girl raises familiar public outcry in India
item.description: The rape and murder of a 13-year-old girl in northern India has sparked fresh public outcry in the country, as it mourns the latest victim in a litany of sex attacks against women and girls.

item.title: Governor Cuomo slams Trump's administration's Covid-19 response
item.description: During his speech at the 2020 Democratic National Convention, Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D-NY) criticized the Trump's administration's response to the pandedmic and says Americans need to vote for Joe Biden in the 2020 presidential election because he is the leader America needs. Watch more convention videos here.

item.title: Black newborns 3 times more likely to die when looked after by White doctors
item.description: Black newborn babies in the United States are more likely to survive childbirth if they are cared for by Black doctors, but three times more likely to die when looked after by White doctors, a study has found.

item.title: Enten: 2020 race tighter than folks think. Here's why
item.description: CNN's Harry Enten says data from five important swing states show that presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden's lead over President Donald Trump is tighter than national polls are showing, but the former vice president is in better shape than Hillary Clinton was in 2016.

item.title: Barack Obama reveals his summer playlist
item.description: On the same night as his wife Michelle Obama delivered a powerful keynote speech at the Democratic National Convention, former President Barack Obama made his own mic-drop statement -- cramming a plethora of bangers from Billie Eilish, Childish Gambino, Sheryl Crow and dozens of other artists into his annual summer playlist.

item.title: Rare footage shows US patrol of South China Sea disrupted
item.description: For the first time in two years, the US Navy is providing CNN with rare footage and interviews aboard a reconnaissance plane flying over the contested South China Sea. The pandemic has not stopped the rising tensions between the US and Chinese Navies, as well as warships of neighboring countries that claim parts of region. CNN's Ivan Watson reports.

item.title: The chip-eating comic keeping people entertained on social media
item.description: Elsa Majimbo is taking over social media by providing comic relief on Instagram and Twitter amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: The K-pop label that created BTS is going public
item.description: The mastermind of global music phenomenon BTS is taking his company public.

item.title: The moments that transformed US political conventions
item.description: US political conventions used to be filled with raucous antics. But reforms over decades have dramatically changed the role of delegates and this year many won't even show up in person. So what actually happens at conventions?

item.title: LeBron James speaks out against voter suppression
item.description: LeBron James has encouraged the Black community to "know their voting rights" after signing a letter to fight voter suppression.

item.title: Mississippi selects its final five designs for new state flag
item.description: Mississippi is getting closer to picking a state flag that residents can vote on in November.

item.title: George Floyd's family leads moment of silence during DNC
item.description: A moment of silence is held during the 2020 virtual Democratic National Convention for George Floyd, with his brother, Philonise Floyd, speaking from Texas in support of Joe Biden.

item.title: Tokyo's latest attraction: Transparent public toilets
item.description: One of Tokyo's most popular districts has recently added some unusual new attractions: transparent public toilets.

item.title: MotoGP rider cheats death and makes history amid crash carnage
item.description: Brad Binder had a front row seat for one of the most terrifying crashes motorsport has ever seen at this weekend's Austrian MotoGP.

item.title: Your smartphone may be able to tell you when you're drunk
item.description: It isn't always easy to know when you've had one alcoholic drink too many, but your smartphone be able to help -- by measuring changes in the way you walk.

item.title: The young West Africans finding their voice through streetwear
item.description: Streetwear has always been about more than just clothing. Over the last three decades it has become a global phenomenon, influenced by a DIY, no-holds-barred attitude expressed through fashion, music, art, dance and skateboarding.

item.title: How can you tell if a giant panda is pregnant?
item.description: Vets detected fetal tissue after giving Mei Xiang, a giant panda at the Smithsonian's National Zoo in DC, an ultrasound. She could give birth within days.

item.title: Paris Hilton says it's 'hard' for her to be normal
item.description: According to Paris Hilton, she's been playing Paris Hilton all of these years.

item.title: A new Dolly Parton mural popped up in Nashville, honoring the singer and her thoughts on Black Lives Matter
item.description: A mural paying tribute to country singer and Tennessee native Dolly Parton and her stance on the Black Lives Matter movement has emerged outside a known music venue in Nashville.

item.title: 'The Office' star shares messages from racist trolls
item.description: 'The Office" actor Leslie David Baker has received racist hateful attacks for trying to produce a spinoff of the series starring his character Stanley Hudson. HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

item.title: The new Girl Scouts cookie flavor is ...
item.description: French toast is no longer just for the breakfast table. Starting in 2021, it can pair just as well with wine as a dessert -- thanks to a new Girl Scouts cookie flavor.

item.title: Why 7-Eleven is getting into tuna jerky, algae oil popcorn and pigless pork rinds
item.description: 7-Eleven, known for its neon-colored Slurpees and oversized sodas, is looking to show off its range by promoting some up-and-coming healthy snack brands at a subset of stores.

item.title: President claims America's most popular woman 'in over her head' after she gives scathing rebuke of Trump
item.description: At an event aimed at highlighting the 100th anniversary of women's right to vote, President Donald Trump disparaged the country's most admired woman, Michelle Obama as "over her head" after she delivered a scathing, direct-to-camera speech criticizing him at the Democratic National Convention Monday.

item.title: How Trump turned his attack into a major self-own
item.description: In the wake of Michelle Obama's blunt warning to the country Monday night on what a second term for Donald Trump would mean, the President was asked about the former first lady's speech at the Democratic National Convention.

item.title: Michelle Obama's speech in full
item.description: During her speech at the 2020 Democratic National Convention, former first lady Michelle Obama argued that Joe Biden's character, compassion and competency makes him a better choice than President Donald Trump in the 2020 presidential election. Watch more convention videos here.

item.title: Obama goes where no former first lady ever has
item.description: What Michelle Obama did at the Democratic National Convention Monday night has forever changed the way that former first ladies will use their tremendous influence during campaigns.

item.title: Michelle Obama sends a message with her necklace
item.description: Michelle Obama called on Americans to vote during her keynote address at the Democratic National Convention.

item.title: These are the prominent Republicans backing Biden
item.description: A number of prominent Republicans have endorsed Joe Biden's presidential bid, handing the former vice president potentially useful support as he looks to win over dissatisfied members of the party.

item.title: UK city attracts Confederate sympathizers
item.description: • Historian: We shouldn't commemorate people who kept others in chains
